Integration Scenarios

  • Once the Communication Systems are transitioned, they would be in an inactive state in V2. It needs to be activated later.
  • Replicating object-wise data ensures ID mapping or document flow for the supported objects.
  • Once the Communication System and the object data are transferred using the Data Transfer Tool, the following configuration should be done in V2:
    • Enter the authentication mechanism in the communication system on V2.
    • Set up Value Mapping in V2.
    • Configure and activate the communication systems. (Refer SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Integration Guide for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and Integrate SAP Sales Cloud and Service Cloud Version 2 Integration for Master Data with SAP S/4HANA).
    • Disconnect the V1 system from S/4HANA or ECC.
    • Activate the Communication systems and the configurations.

General Points:

  1. Extension fields supported via the Data Transfer Tool is limited to 150 at root level, and 30 for non-root entities. Not all data types are supported. Refer to the section 'Extension Fields' for more details.
  2. Default values of KUT fields are not supported.
  3. Extension scenarios are not supported for transition. It must be manually configured in V2.
  4. Fields of type code with values less than 70 in V1 will be created as static code lists.
  5. Fields of type code with values greater than 70 in V1 will be created as custom code lists in V2. These can be accessed from Settings -> All Settings -> Custom Code Lists. All the custom code lists are created with proxy name in V2 (for example, ExtDFE8DF5129E41FD0889F5E7AE0A0ED2D).
  6. Adaptation Changes, Analytical Content, Mashups, Language Adaptations will not be transitioned.
  7. Transition of Code List Restrictions is not supported and hence should be maintained manually in V2.
  8. The Key Metrics available under Accounts in V2 would reflect only the last 3 months (90 days) data for the activities.
  9. The counts (Existing/Sending/Received Instances) in Data Transfer tool, can only serve as an approximation.

With the basics, key object insights, and monitoring in place, youâ€™re now equipped to navigate the SAP Data Transfer Tool and manage data migration effectively.

 For future updates, refer to the official SAP documentation: Data Transfer Tool - SAP Help

entry.title: AI-Powered Dispute Management with SAP Enterprise Service Management (ESM) and S/4HANA Cloud
entry.content:
In todayâ€™s fast-paced business environment, handling customer invoice disputes efficiently is critical to maintaining trust and improving financial operations. SAP Enterprise Service Management (ESM), when integrated with FI-AR Dispute Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, brings automation, AI, and seamless connectivity to streamline the entire process.

What is SAP S/4HANA Dispute Management?

Dispute Management is a subcomponent of SAP S/4HANA Financial Supply Chain Management (FSCM). It enables businesses to record, monitor, and resolve disputes related to customer invoices. With features such as workflow-driven case management, audit trails, and integration to accounts receivable, it ensures that every dispute is handled systematically and efficiently.

Key benefits include:

  • Centralized tracking of disputes
  • Improved collaboration between finance, sales, and customer service teams
  • Automated workflows for faster approvals and escalations
  • Enhanced reporting for dispute trends and root cause analysis

Role of Enterprise Service Management (ESM)

While SAP manages financial disputes effectively, many organizations struggle with cross-functional coordination. Thatâ€™s where ESM comes in. ESM extends the principles of IT Service Management (ITSM) into business domains like Finance, HR, Procurement, and Customer Service.

By integrating SAP Dispute Management with an ESM platform (such as ServiceNow or SAPâ€™s own service management tools), organizations gain:

  • Unified Service Portal: Customers, sales teams, and service agents can log, track, and monitor disputes through a single interface.
  • Automated Ticketing & Routing: Disputes raised in ESM automatically create dispute cases in SAP S/4HANA, ensuring seamless data flow.
  • Real-Time Updates: Resolution progress is synchronized between SAP and the ESM tool, reducing the need for manual follow-ups.

Quick summary of the flow

  • Customer sends email
  • ESM (case management) auto-creates a case
  • AI/OCR extracts invoice number, disputed amount, reason, attachments
  • Validate / enrich by looking up open receivables in S/4HANA
  • Create a formal Dispute record in S/4HANA (tie back to the ESM case)
  • Track, collaborate, resolve and close (sync statuses both ways)

Prerequisites

To enable this end-to-end process, organizations require:

  • An SAP S/4HANA system with FI-AR Dispute Management
  • An Enterprise Service Management platform (e.g., SAP ESM or ServiceNow)
  • A middleware/integration layer such as SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI)
  • Document extraction capabilities for AI/OCR-based data capture

End-to-End Process Flow

The integrated dispute process can be summarized in six steps (as shown in the flow):

 

 

 

1. Customer raises a dispute via email
A customer initiates contact by sending an email to the companyâ€™s shared dispute mailbox (e.g., disputes@company.com). The email may highlight issues such as overcharges, incorrect quantities, or pricing discrepancies and typically includes details like the invoice number, disputed amount, and reason for the dispute.

2. Case Creation

Once the email is received, SAP Enterprise Service Management automatically creates a case and assigns it to the appropriate case type. The system can also categorize the case and route it to the right support team without manual intervention.

3. Information Extraction

Artificial intelligence extracts key details from the emailâ€”such as invoice number, disputed amount, and reason for disputeâ€”converting unstructured text into structured business information that can be used downstream.

4. Lookup Receivable Items

The system then connects to the FI-AR module in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Using the extracted invoice number, it fetches the relevant receivable items. This information is automatically linked to the case, where agents can review and validate it.

5. Create Dispute in SAP S/4HANA

From the case details page, the service agent can create a dispute in SAP S/4HANA Cloud with a single click. The dispute case references the correct invoice, associates the appropriate dispute reason and amount, and links it to the relevant customer master data.

 

6. Case Tracking & Resolution

Through ESM, both internal teams and customers can track the progress of the dispute. Notifications, escalations, and collaboration features ensure timely resolution.

Business Value of SAP S/4HANA + ESM Integration

  • Faster Dispute Resolution: Reduces cycle time by eliminating manual handoffs.
  • Customer Satisfaction: Improves transparency and trust with real-time status visibility.
  • Operational Efficiency: Automates repetitive tasks, freeing teams to focus on high-value work.
  • Data-Driven Insights: Helps organizations identify recurring issues and fix root cause

Conclusion

Integrating SAP S/4HANA Dispute Management with ESM bridges the gap between finance operations and customer-facing services. It transforms dispute resolution from a siloed, manual process into a collaborative, automated, and transparent workflow. For organizations looking to enhance customer experience while safeguarding cash flow, this integration is not just a technical upgrade â€” itâ€™s a strategic move toward financial resilience and service excellence.

In short: Disputes donâ€™t have to be disruptions â€” with S/4HANA and ESM, they can become opportunities for service excellence.

entry.title: Accelerating Service Excellence: AI-Powered Supplier Booking in SAP Service Cloud V2
entry.content:
In service operations, every minute counts. When a customerâ€™s equipment breaks down, the speed at which parts or services can be procured often decides the overall service experience. Traditionally, finding and booking a supplier is a time-consuming, manual process â€” switching across systems, endless searches, and delayed approvals.

With SAP Service Cloud V2, weâ€™ve turned this challenge into an opportunity:
ðŸ‘‰Enabling service agents to search, select, and book suppliers directly from the service order screen â€” backed by real-time integration, AI recommendations, and automated purchase requisition creation in S/4HANA.

Why This Matters

  • Faster service delivery â€“ Agents donâ€™t waste time on manual supplier lookups.
  • Smarter decisions â€“ AI recommends the best supplier based on availability, cost, and past performance.
  • Seamless integration â€“ Purchase requisitions are automatically created in S/4HANA, ensuring compliance.
  • Better customer experience â€“ Faster parts procurement = quicker issue resolution.

How It Works

When customers raise a Case followed by creation of service order by an agent  , speed and accuracy are everything. Delays in finding the right supplier or creating purchase requisitions can slow down resolution and impact customer satisfaction.

ðŸ”¹Step 1: Supplier Search in Service Order

Agents open a Service Order in Service Cloud V2 and access a supplier search panel built with SAP Build Apps.

SAP Build APPs:

 

 

 

 

This the destination where we call SAP S4HANA Suppliers using SAP CAPM

 

ðŸ”¹Step 2: Fetch Supplier Data from S/4HANA

The system makes an API call to S/4HANA to fetch available suppliers with details such as pricing, lead time, and rating.

ðŸ”¹Step 3: AI Recommendation with RAG

We use Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to analyze supplier data and recommend the most suitable supplier for the request.

ðŸ”¹Step 4: Supplier Selection & Purchase Requisition

Once the supplier is confirmed, a Purchase Requisition is instantly created in S/4HANA via API â€” no manual intervention needed.

ðŸ”¹Step 5: Persistence & Metadata with CAP

All supplier interactions, recommendations, and decision logs are stored via SAP CAP, ensuring traceability and audit readiness.

 

This will create a purchase order in S4HANA public cloud 

 

Solution Architecture

  • SAP Service Cloud V2 â€“ Service order management
  • SAP Build Apps â€“ UI for supplier search & booking
  • S/4HANA APIs â€“ Fetch suppliers + post purchase requisition
  • AI with RAG â€“ Intelligent supplier recommendations
  • SAP CAP â€“ Database layer for persistence & metadata

 

 

End-to-End Flow

  1. Agent opens service order in Service Cloud V2.
  2. Supplier search triggered via Build Apps UI.
  3. Supplier data fetched from S/4HANA APIs.
  4. RAG model recommends best supplier.
  5. Agent confirms â†’ Purchase Requisition created in S/4HANA.
  6. Metadata stored in CAP for reporting and audit.

Business Impact

âœ”ï¸80% reduction in supplier booking effort
âœ”ï¸Improved procurement compliance with auto-PR creation
âœ”ï¸AI-driven supplier choice â†’ faster and smarter decisions
âœ”ï¸Unified service experience â€“ all from within Service Cloud V2

Closing Thoughts

This solution is a perfect example of how SAPâ€™s ecosystem (Service Cloud V2, Build Apps, S/4HANA, CAP, and AI) can work together to simplify complex business processes.

By embedding supplier booking directly into the service order workflow, weâ€™ve not only accelerated service execution but also paved the way for intelligent, AI-powered procurement in the future.

entry.title: Joule Skills: Simplifying Employee Data Updates from Chat to Case
entry.content:
ðŸŒŸ Introduction

In todayâ€™s digital workplace, employees expect quick and seamless HR support â€” whether theyâ€™re updating personal details or submitting important requests. SAP Build Joule Skills make this possible by extending SAP Joule, the generative AI copilot, with custom business logic that connects conversational experiences to enterprise systems like SAP SuccessFactors and SAP CX Service Cloud.

This blog explores how Joule Skills transform HR operations by automating co

ðŸ¤– What Are SAP Build Joule Skills?

Joule Skills are custom, AI-powered extensions that enable Joule to perform specific actions or respond intelligently within your organizationâ€™s SAP landscape. With SAP Build, you can design these skills to handle structured inputs, integrate APIs, and trigger backend processes â€” all while maintaining a natural, conversational flow.

In short, Joule Skills let you teach Joule new abilities, such as:

  • Updating employee data in SAP SuccessFactors
  • Creating service requests in SAP CX Service Cloud
  • Fetching policy or compliance details from Knowledge Base Articles (KBAs)
  • Guiding users through document uploads and validation

ðŸ§  What It Is

SAP Build Joule Skills let you teach Joule new capabilities â€” like answering company-specific questions or triggering SAP processes (e.g., updating employee details, checking sales orders, creating service requests, etc.).

Why use Joule skills in HR?

  • Remove manual steps: guide employees with just-in-time guidance and collect exactly the data HR needs.
  • Improve accuracy: structured prompts reduce missing/incorrect data.
  • Bridge chat â†’ case: automatically open service cases and attach metadata and files.
  • Track compliance: add KBA (knowledge base article) checks and required documentation prompts.

ðŸ’¼ HR Use Case: Name Change and Emergency Contact Update

Letâ€™s consider a real-world example.
Employee Jada is getting married and wants to update her last name and emergency contact details in the company HR system.

Hereâ€™s how Joule handles it seamlessly:

  1. Employee Interaction:
    Jada opens the HR portal and types,
    â€œI need to update my last name and emergency contact due to an upcoming marriage.â€

  2. Guided Workflow:
    Joule responds with relevant KBA links, explaining required documents and steps.

  3. Data Collection:
    Joule asks for:

  • New last name
  • Emergency contact name and phone number
  • Marriage date
  • Marriage certificate upload

    Joule validates the inputs and triggers backend automation to:

    • Create a service case in SAP CX Service Cloud, ensuring HR teams can track and process the update.
    • Update Jadaâ€™s profile in SAP SuccessFactors with her new personal details automatically.
    • Confirmation:
      Joule confirms submission and provides a case reference for tracking.

ðŸ§© Why Joule Skills Matter for HR

  • Reduce manual effort: Employees can initiate updates via chat without filling multiple forms.
  • Ensure accuracy: Structured prompts ensure complete and validated data.
  • Enhance compliance: Automatically check KBAs or policy documents before submission.
  • Improve employee experience: Faster resolutions and transparent status tracking.

Steps: Integrate the Process into a Joule Skill

1. Open the SAP Build Lobby, choose Sales Order Assistant Joule Skill project.

2. Click Create, then Joule Skill.

3.Enter name update_personal_details and description Allows the user to update their last name and emergency contact information due to an upcoming marriage..

4. Click Parameters and configure Skill Inputs and Skill Input as mentioned

6. Choose Add Input three times and enter the following parameters:

Case Creation Skill

Similarly, create Joule skills that can call APIs for SuccessFactors name change and case creation.

6. Choose New Conversation.

A case is automatically created in Service Cloud V2, and simultaneously, the employeeâ€™s last name is updated in SAP SuccessFactors through the integrated Joule skill

âœ… Conclusion

SAP Build Joule Skills bring intelligence and automation to everyday HR scenarios. By bridging conversational AI with SAPâ€™s core systems, they empower employees to self-serve while ensuring HR teams maintain control, compliance, and efficiency.

In our example, what used to take multiple emails and forms now happens in one smooth interaction â€” from chat to case creation to record update.
With Joule Skills, organizations can reimagine HR service delivery and bring true AI-driven automation to the heart of employee experience.

entry.title: From Data to Delightâ€”How SAP CX AI Toolkit Transforms Customer Experiences
entry.content:
Introduction
As customerâ€™s needs evolve at lightning speed, itâ€™s more important than ever for businesses to truly tap into their data and unlock new possibilities to stay one step ahead. The SAP CX AI Toolkit is revolutionizing how organizations automate, streamline, and enhance customer interactions. By blending next-generation AI with advanced data analytics, the toolkit accelerates productivity and reveals actionable insights across sales, service, and commerce domains. Additionally, Jouleâ€”the integrated AI copilotâ€”offers a seamless interface for accessing all the toolkitâ€™s power.

Why SAP CX AI Toolkit?

SAP CX AI Toolkit bridges operational silos, bringing together CRM, email, and business systems to create efficient, role-specific workflows. With Generative AI features, it streamlines repetitive tasks, delivers proactive business intelligence, and empowers your teams to make smarter decisionsâ€”saving you hours and driving tangible results.

Key Benefits

  • Informed Decisions: Combine enterprise and operational data to empower intelligent, data-driven choices.
  • Automated Tasks: Eliminate manual effort by automating routine actions within your teamâ€™s existing workspaceâ€”whether in a dedicated app or through Joule.
  • Faster Customer Response: Quickly understand customer needs and respond with timely, AI-powered insights derived from comprehensive enterprise data.

Comprehensive Features & Highlights

  1. Role-Specific AI Tools
    The toolkit delivers specialized AI capabilities tailored to vital CX roles:
  • Customer communication automation
  • Summarization of records and meetings
  • Object and image recognition
  • Contextual prompts for sales, service, and marketing
    These tools enable every team to work faster and smarter.
  1. Robust Data Protection
    With best-in-class personal data protection and zero data retention policies, SAP CX AI Toolkit ensures your sensitive enterprise information remains secure and compliant.
  2. Multi-Source Data Integration
    Aggregate and analyze data from diverse systemsâ€”Sales, Service, Commerce, CDP, Microsoft 365â€”and unlock insights across every customer touchpoint.
  3. Configurable Tools
    From data sources to generative templates and prompts, every element is tailored to your organizationâ€™s needs, allowing a customized CX automation strategy.

Persona-Based Licensing
SAP CX AI Toolkitâ€™s functionality is organized around three distinct licensesâ€”usable individually or combined, based on your operational persona:

  • SAP Sales Cloud Version 2
  • SAP Service Cloud Version 2
  • SAP Commerce Cloud

Each license unlocks targeted features:

License Type

Key Tools & Features

All Licenses

Intelligent Q&A, Smart Actions, Meetings, Scheduling

Sales Cloud V2

Opportunity Summarization, Prospecting Emails, Discovery Call Questions

Service Cloud V2

Case Overview, Customer Service Responses, Knowledge Base Article Creation

Combined Licenses

Meeting Summaries, Follow-up Emails, Account Overviews

Commerce Cloud

Product Attributes, Descriptions, Image Generation, Visual Search, Blog & Social Posts

 

User Interfaces: Accessing SAP CX AI Toolkit
The toolkit is flexibly accessible through several user interfaces:

  • Web App: Log in using SAP or Microsoft credentials to set up your tenant and access tools as per your license. The web app features an intuitive dashboard, a searchable Q&A bar, customizable AI panels, real-time notifications, and process monitoring.
  • Chrome Extension (Joule): Installable from the Chrome Web Store, Joule places AI functionality at your fingertips across business applications like Outlook Web, SAP Cloud for Customer, and SAP Commerce Cloud. Features are context-aware and can be accessed directly as a browser overlay.
  • Embedded Panel: Integrated into SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 as a right-side panel, delivering the full web app experience in-context with contact, account, case, and opportunity data.

In-depth Feature Exploration

Intelligent Q&A
Leverages Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) to provide precise, natural-language answers to work-related questions by drawing from your enterprise sourcesâ€”emails, meeting transcripts, documents, service tickets, product specs, and more. Data privacy is built-in, with no personal data stored in AI models.

Generative AI Tools
Adapted for three core ecosystems, these tools automate:

  • Microsoft 365: Meeting summaries and follow-up emails
  • SAP C4C, Sales & Service Cloud V2: Account/Opportunity summaries, prospecting emails, case overviews, customer service responses, knowledge base articles, discovery call questions
  • SAP Commerce Cloud: Blog/social media post generation, product banner text, ATP inquiries, product review summaries

SAP Commerce Cloud Features

  • AI Product Tagging: Automatically generate and enrich product attributes.
  • Product Description Generation: Create and translate compelling catalog and marketing texts.
  • Product Image Generation: Enhance images, add overlays, and edit visuals.
  • Visual Search: Find catalog products using user-uploaded imagesâ€”transforming discovery and search.

AI Tools Builder & Agents
Customize the toolkit with AI tools and intelligent agents tailored to your business needs, such as service classification, knowledge base article generation, shopping advice, quote automation, and catalog optimization.

Persona-Based Use Cases

Sales Cloud V2:

  • Combine emails, chats, and sales data for rich insights
  • Generate dynamic content for effective sales outreach
  • Quick, trustworthy answers and efficient interaction summaries
  • Personalized prospecting emails and targeted follow-up actions

Service Cloud V2:

  • Streamline case management and service responses
  • Auto-generate knowledge base content
  • Leverage smart scheduling and notifications for efficient service delivery

Commerce Cloud:

  • Enrich product content and images with AI
  • Automate catalog descriptions and visual searching
  • Drive engagement through AI-powered blog and social posts

Custom AI Tool API Support

The SAP CX AI Toolkit also empowers developers with Custom AI Tool API Supportâ€”a set of Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that enable seamless integration of advanced, tailor-made Artificial Intelligence solutions within external applications. This means organizations can extend AI-driven outcomes to new business scenarios, connecting their unique workflows and data landscapes with the intelligence of SAP CX AI Toolkit agents.

Smarter Customer Engagement with AI Agents

SAP CX AI Toolkit features AI agentsâ€”Shopping Agent and Digital Service Agentâ€”each designed to address distinct phases of the customer journey.

Shopping Agent: Your Digital Sales Associate

The Shopping Agent transforms your commerce storefront by engaging customers through natural language conversations. Acting as a knowledgeable digital associate, it understands everything from specific requestsâ€”such as â€œI need a lightweight rain jacketâ€â€”to broader needs like â€œIâ€™m planning a beach vacation.â€ The agent instantly provides tailored responses, including details about product features, compatibility, and recommendations.

Configuration is flexible, you can integrate the Shopping Agent directly into your online catalog using SAP CX AI Toolkit, and the agent converses in the customerâ€™s language. Purpose-built for both B2B and B2C scenarios (activated via API configuration), the Shopping Agent proactively interacts with customers, refining product suggestions through relevant follow-up questions and guiding them throughout their shopping experience.

Key Capabilities of the Shopping Agent include:

  • Helping customers find and compare products using conversational AI.
  • Understanding and processing complex customer queries through intuitive dialogue.
  • Integrating seamlessly with your e-commerce storefront via a robust, flexible API.

Knowledge Base Integration:
The Shopping Agent can process unstructured data in varied formats as part of its knowledge base. By uploading product manuals, catalogs, or specification documents (PDF, image, text, spreadsheet formats, etc.) to SAP Commerce Cloud, you arm the agent with deep, detailed product knowledge to answer nuanced customer queries.

Digital Service Agent: Intelligent Post-Purchase Support

The Digital Service Agent is designed to deliver top-tier, automated customer support in natural language. Leveraging specific business knowledge sourcesâ€”configured by your administratorâ€”it answers post-purchase inquiries, resolving common issues and freeing up your service team for escalated cases.

This agent can operate solo or alongside the Shopping Agent, providing unified and continuous support throughout a customerâ€™s lifecycle. For example, after a purchase, a customer with a warranty question interacts with the Digital Service Agent, who pulls relevant informationâ€”even translating responses if needed for multilingual scenarios.

Key Capabilities of the Digital Service Agent include:

  • Operating 24/7 to provide answers using precise business knowledge sources (manuals, FAQs, service tickets).
  • Handling service-related requests such as checking order status, processing returns, or addressing product issues.
  • Assisting in both B2B and B2C environments, with API-driven flexibility.

Comparison: Shopping Agent vs. Digital Service Agent

Feature

Shopping Agent (Digital Sales Associate)

Digital Service Agent (Customer Support)

Primary Goal

Drive sales, product discovery, pre-purchase assistance

Resolve service issues, post-purchase customer support

Key Functions

Recommends products; provides features/specs/compatibility info

Answers inquiries (warranties, returns, order status); FAQs

Data Sources

Product catalog & related documents/media

Knowledge base, service tickets, admin-configured sources

Integration

Direct commerce storefront integration

Standalone or in tandem with Shopping Agent

Focus

Product- and sales-oriented

Service- and resolution-oriented

 

In essence, the Shopping Agent is your digital sales expert, while the Digital Service Agent is your first-responder customer service assistant. Integrated together, they deliver a seamless, unified customer experience across all stages of the journey.

Conclusion
SAP CX AI Toolkit is more than a set of AI toolsâ€”itâ€™s an innovation engine for your customer experience strategy. With deep integration, robust security, and persona-driven features, businesses can transform the way data is leveraged to create exceptional customer and employee experiences. Whether accessed via the web app, Chrome extension, or embedded panels, SAP CX AI Toolkit is ready to propel enterprises into the future of AI-powered customer interactions.

entry.title: Integrate GitHub Copilot with SAP Cloud Application Studio
entry.content:
Requirement: 
To integrate GitHub Copilot with SAP Cloud Application Studio.

Introduction:
GitHub Copilot integration in Visual Studio Code offers powerful AI assistance for SAP Cloud Application Studio developers working on SAP C4C. It helps transform natural language prompts into ABSL scripts, automates repetitive coding tasks, and enhances logic building with intelligent suggestions. By streamlining development and reducing manual effort, Copilot boosts productivity and supports faster delivery of high-quality solutions.

Benefits of GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio/Cloud Application Studio

  • Supports complex logic building by offering real-time suggestions for conditional flows, loops, and data manipulations in ABSL.
  • Boosts productivity by reducing time spent on boilerplate code, allowing developers to focus on business-specific requirements.
  • Improves accuracy by minimizing syntax errors and offering context-aware completions based on SAP C4C development patterns.
  • Encourages collaboration by making code easier to understand and maintain, especially for teams working across different modules or geographies.

Sign In with GitHub Account:
STEP 1:
Click on GitHub Copilot -> Open Chat Window to Sign In

STEP 2:
GitHub Copilot login page will be opened. Click on â€œSign up for Copilot Freeâ€

STEP 3:
Signup page will be opened. Click on â€œCreate an accountâ€.

STEP 4:
Enter user details and create an account.

STEP 5:
Open SDK and click on â€œSign Inâ€

STEP 6:
Click on â€œAuthorize githubâ€

STEP 7:
User can access GitHub copilot now in SAP Cloud Application studio.

Open GitHub Chat:
GitHub copilot can be opened in two ways,

  • Separate Chat window.
  • Copilot assistant in script file.

1)Separate chat window.
Click on GitHub Copilot -> Open Chat Window

A copilot chat window will be open separately as shown below.

2)Copilot assistant in script file.
Open script file and click on â€œAsk Copilotâ€ from the menu option

Copilot chat option will be opened inside the script file.

Start Typing with Comments or Partial Code:
CASE 1: ABSL Scripting Assistance
Copilot helps generate ABSL (Advanced Business Scripting Language) code by interpreting natural language prompts. Whether you're writing BeforeSave, AfterModify, or ValidationOnSave scripts, Copilot can suggest logic structures, syntax, and even error handling patterns, reducing development time and minimizing syntax errors.
Example:

  • Prompt: â€œwrite code to raise an error message, if the email ID is testmail@gmail.comâ€

Prompt response:

CASE 2 : Review and refine code
If you're working with legacy or repetitive code, Copilot can help refactor loops, simplify conditions, and remove redundancy. It acts like a virtual reviewer, offering cleaner alternatives and improving overall code quality.
Example:

  • Prompt:â€ Identify the lines of code which has dump issues and fix it.â€

    In below screen shot Copilot Identified the inconsistent lines in red and provided fix/suggestions in green color.

Prompt response:

CASE 3: To Explain the code
GitHub Copilot uses AI to understand the context of your code and comments, offering real-time suggestions and explanations. It would help the developers in understanding the code quickly, there by saving the time and efforts for analysis.
Example:

  • Prompt: Explain me the selected lines of code

Prompt response:

  • Prompt: Explain me the code in the script file

Prompt response:

CASE 4: Basic syntax generation
GitHub Copilot can help developers working in SAP Cloud Application Studio by generating basic ABSL (Advanced Business Scripting Language) syntax. It understands the context of business objects and actions, offering ready-to-use code snippets like variable declarations, loops, and conditional statements. This accelerates development and reduces errors, especially for those new to ABSL.

Conclusion:
Using GitHub Copilot in SAP C4C development streamlines coding by offering intelligent suggestions tailored to the platformâ€™s scripting and extension needs. It boosts developer productivity by reducing repetitive tasks and helping maintain clean, consistent code. Copilot also serves as a valuable learning aid for those new to SAP C4C, guiding them through SDK usage and integration patterns.

entry.title: Case Management: Case Hierarchy (Main Cases and Sub-Cases)
entry.content:
Introduction:

In modern case management systems, efficient organization of information is essential for delivering fast and accurate resolutions. Businesses today deal with increasingly complex service requests, operational tasks, and customer interactions. To manage this complexity, leading organizations rely on a hierarchical case structure consisting of main cases and sub-cases. This model provides clarity, accountability, and scalability, enabling teams to divide work intelligently without losing the connection to the bigger picture. With a clear case hierarchy, companies can accelerate issue resolution, improve customer satisfaction, and create a more predictable service operation.

Imagine a customer reports a serious issue that touches multiple departmentsâ€”support needs to investigate, field service must schedule a visit, and billing has to verify an error. Handling everything under one case would quickly become messy. Thatâ€™s where case hierarchy shines. A main case captures the overall problem, while sub-cases help each team manage their part of the work independently, yet still stay tied to the larger story.

Configuration:

In SAP Service Cloud v2, Case Hierarchy is offered as a separate feature that customers can enable at the case-type level. It also provides flexibility, allowing configuration changes across different case-type versions. At any given time, only one version of a case type can be active.

1. Open a draft case type version in detail view

 2. In the General tab, activate the Case Hierarchy feature within the Features Settings section. Once enabled, the Case Hierarchy functionality becomes available for that specific case type.

 3. After enabling the feature, a new tab called Relationship Settings becomes available. Navigate to this tab to proceed.

 4. Select a cascade completion mechanism for main and subcases. There are three options available for the completion mechanism. The first is None, where the main case and sub-cases can be completed independently. The second option, Don't allow main case completion until all sub-cases are completed, prevents closure of the main case until its sub-cases are finished. The third option, Complete all sub-cases when the main case is completed, automatically closes all sub-cases when the main case is completed. These options are largely self-explanatory.

5. Select the appropriate options based on your requirements, then click Save to apply the changes.

6. Click Activate to activate the case type.

Case Hierarchy in Action:

Hiring a Candidate in an Enterprise Service Management Scenario: Consider the process of hiring a new candidateâ€”a common enterprise workflow that requires coordination across several internal departments. Although it begins as a single request, the end-to-end hiring process consists of multiple activities handled by different teams. This makes it an ideal scenario for using Case Hierarchy with a main case and multiple sub-cases.

When a hiring request is submitted, a main case is created to represent the overall process: onboarding a new employee. This main case captures the core details such as candidate information, job role, joining date, and overall status.

However, completing this process requires contributions from multiple departments: 

1. IT Department â€” IT Setup Sub-Case

The IT team needs to prepare all the necessary resources for the new hire. A sub-case is created to handle tasks such as Laptop allocation and configuration, Email account and system access creation, Software license provisioning and Setting up workstation or remote access. This sub-case is managed independently by IT but remains linked to the main hiring case.

2. Finance Department â€” Payroll & Compliance Sub-Case

Finance also plays a crucial role in onboarding. Their sub-case may include: Setting up payroll for the new employee, Assigning cost centers or budgeting codes, Compliance checks for compensation and benefits and Approvals related to financial onboarding. Again, these tasks are handled within the Finance sub-case but contribute to completing the overall hiring process.

3. HR Department â€” HR Onboarding Sub-Case

The HR team completes several onboarding formalities, such as: Gathering and validating documents, Generating the offer letter and appointment contract, Assigning training, onboarding programs, and buddy systems, Ensuring background checks are completed and Capturing employee master data in the HR system. All of these actions are tracked in a dedicated HR sub-case.

Letâ€™s create a case to demonstrate this scenario.

1. Create a new case with the newly activated case type and open the case in detail view.

2. To create a sub-case, click the Create button and select Sub-Case.

 3. Once the sub-cases are created, review them in the Sub-Cases section under the Related Entities tab. This tab and section are adaptation-relevant, so they must be added to the screen through Adaptation if they are not already visible.

 4. The Sub-Cases section also allows you to link an existing case as a sub-case. Click the Add Subcases button and choose the appropriate case from the value help and click on Apply.

Here, you can enter a search term, press Enter, and then select the desired case from the list.

Alternatively, click the value help icon to open the case list modal and choose the required case.

Click Apply to link the selected case as a sub-case.

It will then be displayed instantly in the related entities sub-cases section.

Use the Full Screen button to enlarge the section for better viewing.

Hover over the case card to reveal the Remove button, then click it to delink the sub-case.

For the current case type version, the completion mechanism â€œDonâ€™t allow main case completion until all sub-cases are completedâ€ is selected. This prevents the main case from being completed until all its sub-cases are resolved. If attempted to complete the main case before completing the sub-cases, a validation message is displayed.

The system will enforce the configured completion mechanism accordingly.

The hierarchy supports only one level, meaning a parent case can have sub-cases, but a sub-case cannot have its own sub-cases.

Summary:

Case Hierarchy in modern case management systems provides a structured way to manage complex processes by linking a main case with one or more sub-cases. This approach enables organizations to break down large tasks into manageable units while maintaining visibility and control over the overall workflow.

Key points:

  • Feature Enablement: In SAP Service Cloud v2, Case Hierarchy is a separate feature that must be enabled at the case-type level and can be configured differently across case-type versions. At any given time, only one version of a case type can be active.

  • Hierarchy Structure: A main case can have multiple sub-cases, but sub-cases cannot have further child cases, supporting a single-level hierarchy.

  • Completion Mechanism: The system supports configurable completion rules, such as allowing independent closure of main and sub-cases, preventing main case completion until sub-cases are finished, or automatically completing all sub-cases when the main case is closed.

  • Operational Flow: Sub-cases can be created directly or linked from existing cases. Departments like HR, IT, Finance, Facilities, Security, and, if relevant, Travel Desk (for relocations) typically manage the sub-cases, each handling specialized tasks while contributing to the main caseâ€™s resolution.

  • Benefits: Case Hierarchy enhances collaboration across departments, ensures accountability, improves tracking, and provides a clear view of progress at both sub-case and main case levels.

In essence, Case Hierarchy simplifies complex business processes by structuring work into related cases, ensuring that each task is efficiently tracked and managed while maintaining alignment with the overall objective.

entry.title: Your Path to SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 Starts Here: Understanding the DTT
entry.content:
Your Path to SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 Starts Here: Understanding the DTT

Introduction to the Data Transfer Tool (DTT)

In this blog post, I would like to introduce you to the Data Transfer Tool (DTT) in the SAP Sales & Service Cloud.
Before we dive into the tool itself, letâ€™s take a look at the steps and prerequisites required to enable and use the DTT successfully.

Prerequisites & Activation of the Data Transfer Tool

Step 1: Create an Incident

Open an incident in SAP for Me with the appropriate component â€œLOD-LE-MIG-CNSâ€.
Important: You need to have a V2 system that is connected to your SAP Sales & Service Cloud V1 system for the transition. Both systems must be referenced in the incident.

Step 2: Enable the Tool for Administrators

Once the Data Transfer Tool has been approved, you need to enable it for your administrators or colleagues performing the transition.
Go to the Administration Settings in your V1 system and enable the â€œTransitionâ€ Work Center for the relevant business role.

Step 3: End User Access

After the role assignment, end users will see the Transition Work Center and gain access to the Data Transfer Tool.

Step 4: Start Working with the DTT

Once everything is set up, you can begin preparing and executing your data migration.

Note #1 â€“ Preparation Is Key

Before performing any migration, it is highly recommended to
review the Help Page of each relevant data object. These pages contain essential information on:

âœ” Prerequisites 
Example: For Cases/Tickets, the Case Types must be manually created in the V2 system before migration, so they can be mapped correctly.

âœ” Restrictions
Example: For Registered Products, the migration of KUT fields is currently not supported.

âœ” Data Sequences
Example: For Leads, activities and master data (such as Business Partners) must be migrated first.

Tip: Create a Migration Activity Plan to keep track 
            of dependencies, required sequences, and task responsibilities.


User Interface Overview of the Data Transfer Tool

The DTT interface provides several columns and sections that help you understand the migration status at a glance.

Column overview (left to right):

  1. Objects â€“ List of all data objects that can be migrated via DTT
  2. More Information â€“ Link to the object-specific Help Page
  3. Existing Instances â€“ Number of records in the V1 system
  4. Triggered By â€“ User who initiated the migration
  5. Triggered On â€“ Timestamp of execution
  6. Sending Instances â€“ Number of records sent
  7. Error Sending Instances â€“ Error messages for failed records
  8. Send Status â€“ Shows status (e.g. Finished when complete)
  9. Received Instances â€“ Number of records received in the V2 system
  10. Delta Mode â€“ Automatically activated after a successful initial migration (shown in green)
  11. Target Tenant â€“ URL of the V2 target system

Dynamic Object Scoping: Extension Fields and Additional Details

Below the object list, additional information may appear depending on the selected object, such as:

Extension Fields (KUT Fields)

  • Node Name â€“ Location of the field in the data model
  • Field Name â€“ UI name
  • Usage Rate â€“ Indicates whether the field is actively used
  • Owner â€“ e.g. KUT
  • Transition Ability â€“ Whether the field can be migrated via DTT
  • Transfer â€“ Selection to include or exclude the field during migration

Transfer History

  • Listing the last migration executions for the related Data Object

Error Details

  • Listing the details of migration errors

Document Type Mapping (e.g. for Data object â€œCaseâ€)

  • This is the place were you would configure the Case type mapping bevore you are executing the migration of Tickets from SAP Sales and Service Cloud to SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2.

 

Key Actions in the Upper-Right Section of the DTT

This area contains the main execution functions:

  1. Test Data Transfer â€“ Transfers a single data object including its Business Configuration
  2. Transfer Data â€“ Transfers all data records of the selected object plus its Business Configuration
  3. Transfer BC â€“ Transfers only the Business Configuration
  4. Stop Delta â€“ Deactivates the delta mechanism
  5. Start Post-Processing â€“ Triggers object-specific follow-up processes
  6. Documentation â€“ Access to the latest DTT documentation


Note #2 â€“ Advantages & Limitations of the Data Transfer Tool

Advantages

  1. Business Configuration is transferred
    Unlike migration via Data Workbench, the DTT also transfers the related configuration of the data object.
  1. Preserves Object IDs and UUIDs
    The DTT keeps the same object IDs from V1, ensuring seamless continuity for integrations and historical references.
  1. Automatic Mapping
    Relationships between master data and transactional data remain intact after migration.

Current Limitations

  1. No filtering available
    The DTT currently does not support filtering records before migrationâ€”everything is transferred.

  2. Limited monitoring capabilities
    There is no detailed, record-level monitoring, making it difficult to identify missing or failed data without additional effort.
